collection.title: When
collection.description: When it happened, by year or season

set.title: Stanley Lake Snow Hike
set.description: I borrow Kayla’s Brazil backpack — cerulean with a yellow silk flower — so I can join a co-worker for a short hike and camp trip somewhere around Stanley.

set.title: Kuna Cave Fails to Impress
set.description: I have had my fill of the place but I think Brenna might find Kuna Cave a fun adventure so her and Hunter join me in the little car for the short drive to dusty spelunking while Jessica is busy with meetings.

set.title: Juniper Gulch Hike
set.description: Wherein I hike with three young ladies among swoopdongles and bibbelty bobs amidst the litterbox smell of blue-berried junipers.

set.title: Spring Fish & Chips
set.description: Brenna, Jessica and I spend a sunny spring afternoon bicycling Boise’s Greenbelt along the river through six parks with a pitstop at Joe’s Crabshack to grease the wheels.

set.title: Until the Fog Lifts
set.description: I spent an afternoon planning a winter 2016 motorcycle loop but thought better of it as I noticed the mud I’ve been pedaling through to work. So I made a word salad about mud.

set.title: Moving to Japan
set.description: Laura finds she won’t have time to prepare for her semester in Japan and also visit us for Christmas so Jessica and I make a quick decision to drive up for the weekend to see and help her pack.

set.title: Danskin November
set.description: With special dispensation from Jessica, I hastily changed oil, cleaned the chain and otherwise prepared the bike for what may be the last ride of 2015. I rode hard until dark, meeting along the way fiddling friends, Mickey and Moose, for whom are named popular flats above the South Fork of the Boise River.

set.title: Military Reserve
set.description: The final mild days of autumn and a new co-worker from Twin Falls, also a photo enthusiast, are occasion to walk the riparian ravine — a green stripe among beige hills — in Boise’s nearby Military Reserve.

set.title: Chalk and Basalt
set.description: Brilliant but cool autumn days beckon. Jessica, Hunter, Brenna and I drove south to explore again the Lake Idaho seabed, hoping for treasures emotional and material.

set.title: Brother Ride 2015: Over Moscow Mountain
set.description: The last of our five day ride requires only that we make it to our mother’s house in the evergreen hills between Troy and Moscow, Idaho. This day seems always to arrive sooner than expected, four brothers, five days in the blink of an eye.

set.title: Brother Ride 2015: Huckleberry Lookout
set.description: The fourth of our five day ride begins with single track. We climb through trees from our meadow campsite to ridges that lead us to the historic Red Ives Ranger Station. Then we speed through showers on the little highway along the St. Joe River for much needed fuel in Avery before continuing back to forest climbs up to Huckleberry Lookout. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/AFAEU7yoZ6w

set.title: Brother Ride 2015: Simmons Creek
set.description: The third of our five day ride has no food or fuel stops. We descend from Shefoot and follow the Idaho-Montana border south to the St. Joe headwaters to camp near Simmons and Washout Creeks. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/7SNdAq2c4qY

set.title: Brother Ride 2015: Snow on Shefoot
set.description: On the second of our five day ride, my three brothers and I follow mountain ridges through sodden clouds from our campsite along Big Creek to Wallace for gas and lunch at the Red Light Garage then over Moon Pass to sleep on Shefoot. The weather is entertaining. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/C6uxreLKrAc

set.title: Brother Ride 2015: Up Big Creek
set.description: We meet for the eighth year in a row, my brothers and I, to ride and camp off our motorcycles for a few days in Idaho mountains. Fires and a funny forecast mean we aren’t sure what we’re getting into. For the first day of five, we ride from our mother’s house on forest roads to tiny Calder, Idaho, along the St. Joe then up the tributary Big Creek. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/Zl9se9nEI2M

set.title: Boulder Basin Team Building
set.description: Boulder Basin came to mind when the need for a getaway arose. It’s about as far removed from civilization as you can get in an automobile around here, enough of a trip that you’d best plan on spending the night. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/8mieqdlWR0E

set.title: Overnight on Hunter’s Knoll
set.description: You can’t keep us indoors with Jessica once again away. I let the kids vote (probably a mistake) on an hour drive or three with our resulting sights set on an overnight among the trees overlooking Boise. At least we won’t end up stuck in big mountain snow. Or will we?

set.title: Lava, Rattlesnake and Devil Creeks
set.description: An idea to ride overnight in the Upper Reynolds Creek area gave way to a simpler day ride to check on my old friend Lava Mountain and see if I could connect from there across Bear Gulch for a half-day of riding single track by myself. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/pRWEHQsYYek

set.title: Willow Creek Campground
set.description: Jessica is out of town. You know what that calls for! Camping. Since she’ll have the Jeep, we’ll make due with campground camping we can reach with the baby hippo car. I’ve always liked the look of a few spots above Arrowrock Reservoir so we set our heading accordingly. Engage!

set.title: Celebration Park Picnic
set.description: This warm and dry spring inspires a hot dog and marshmallow excursion to the Snake River where kids have played on a curious collection of round boulders for a thousand years.

set.title: March in Lower Hulls Gulch
set.description: Working on pictures of a previous Hulls Gulch walk brought it to mind. It’s been a few years since we visited. A beautiful, sunny weekend beckons.

set.title: Swan Falls Dam to Wilson Creek via Murphy
set.description: Michael and I take advantage of unseasonably warm February weather to explore roads and histories south of the Snake River. [ Addendum: I’ve added images at the end showing some motorized restrictions we overlooked during the ride. Plan accordingly. ] Video (1024x576): youtu.be/tDENDkPm6Dc

set.title: Light December Snow
set.description: The last two days of 2014 are dusted with snow and colored with sun, a dichotomy I’m glad to indulge with several stops while biking to and from my office downtown. May the new year be so beautiful.

set.title: Atlanta Thanksgiving 2014
set.description: It was down to the wire whether our Thanksgiving with Heather, Eric and kids could be at their cabin in Atlanta, Idaho. Record breaking November snowfall left the sixty mile mountain dirt road impassable. But a quick melt has things back on track. Or so it seems.

set.title: Ten Degrees Too Early
set.description: Winter came a month early. I enjoy the blanket of sparkling white and added challenge of biking a slippery path. It sure would have been great to rake the leaves up first, though. Oh well. The fiery fog and glowing hoar frost are beautiful just the same.

set.title: Cotton Candy After a Wood Duck Walk
set.description: We must make the most of our favorite season, walks and rides, fast and furious, before the last leaf falls. We park in Bown Crossing near Brenna’s school for an evening walk along the river before sitting to dinner and perhaps a treat.

set.title: Home Along the River
set.description: The sharp morning light of a week ago is today muted by mist rolling off the cold water along my bicycle commute to work. Lucky for me, this common autumn scene never fails to delight and I’m glad for the chance to meander.

set.title: Election Leaves
set.description: Political outcomes won’t change it: things that brought joy yesterday are those which bring joy today — full suspension bunny-hop from asphalt to dirt, glittering leaves and deep breaths of cold air.

set.title: Autumn Camping Above Silver City
set.description: Something we’ve said we’d do for a while now, we load the kids up to visit Silver City then camp somewhere in the hills above. It was near freezing when I camped with my brothers recently but it seems warmer now. I hope so.

set.title: Brother Ride 2014: Big Trinity
set.description: From 9,000 feet to 9,000 feet, my three brothers and I leave Washington Basin for lunch and fuel in Ketchum before beginning our westward leg along the South Fork of the Boise River toward home. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/Lplv3ec27A0

set.title: Brother Ride 2014: Washington Basin
set.description: From our wet campsite along Canyon Creek below Pinyon Peak, my three brothers and I ride over Loon Creek Summit to visit the Yankee Fork Dredge then, deviating from earlier plans, we take lunch in Stanley before finding our way to camp high in Washington Basin. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/ESkvIRqKW4M

set.title: Brother Ride 2014: Pinyon Peak
set.description: Along Deadwood Reservoir, through Bear Valley to Pinyon Peak, our second day of riding treats us to vistas even more vast. We are held up by mechanical troubles but not deterred. Rocks in our path are an integral and expected part of the experience. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/UnBRKvH4KXI

set.title: Brother Ride 2014: Scott Mountain
set.description: The first day of our seventh annual Abbott Brother Ride, this time, for the first time, in South Central Idaho. We stage at my house then head over the Boise Ridge, from desert to forest, on our way to high mountains. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/dXexasadjZQ

set.title: Switchbacks to Goat Lake
set.description: Michael and I ride from Boise through Prairie and across the mountains to Pine and Featherville before turning north to camp around a high mountain lake. We cover highway, gravel, dirt roads, ATV and singletrack, a real dual sport adventure. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/D25IrwB0mOA

set.title: McCroskey to Bald Mountain
set.description: Jeremy and I travel from our homes to Farmington, Washington, for some quick riding with our brother Joel around our childhood stomping grounds north of Moscow Mountain.

set.title: Birch Creek Sandcastle
set.description: Keeping to the recent pattern, we drive south with the kids to camp at a place in the Owyhees I reconnoitered by motorcycle, stopping along the way to see the Owyhee Museum in Murphy.

set.title: Hunter Rides Daggett
set.description: Hunter leads us up Rocky Canyon to the Boise Ridge and a great campsite he finds near Deer Point. The next morning, in spite of a warning, he decides to brave Daggett Creek.

set.title: Owyhee Snow and Sand: Lowlands
set.description: From my secret campsite behind Silver City (disregarding the GPS track), I descend Bachman Grade to explore some lesser known canyons within the Owyhee Front. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/WYvg5VV3T8E

set.title: Owyhee Snow and Sand: Uplands
set.description: I ride across the Snake up Reynolds Creek to explore roads and routes I’ve not seen before camping somewhere in the mountains behind Silver City. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/U8Y5rBOhz0s

set.title: Riverside With My Hula Girl
set.description: She was so excited by the prospect of a simple walk by the river, how could I say no. So after days of intermittent rain, Brenna and I spend two hours walking the familiar paths near home. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/ZWt0rWaPpS8

set.title: Three Fingers Gulch
set.description: Michael and I ride from Succor Creek Road through the Oregon Owyhees in an eighty mile loop around Three Fingers Butte.

set.title: Little Brenna at Little Jacks Creek
set.description: She has been asking about it almost daily for weeks and finally we’re making it happen, a camp out for just Brenna and me. I liked what I saw last week motorcycling around Little Jacks Creek so that’s where we are headed with hot dogs, marshmallows and our best hiking flip-flops.

set.title: Oreana and Little Jacks Creek
set.description: Per my usual process for a solo ride, I pan around Google Earth looking to see things I haven’t seen, consult with the Idaho Trails site and finally lay out a route in the GPS software. It works great thirty percent of the time.

set.title: Three Prong Approach to Jump Creek
set.description: After running through some options to break the television-watching rain routine, we settle on the forty-five minute drive to Jump Creek Falls, what some call a “locals’” attraction because of unclear, zig-zag access through private pastures and occasional use by teen revelers.

set.title: Winter Sticks and Bridges
set.description: Feeling cooped up on a cold weekend while Jessica is away, I suggest a walk along the river. The inversion is finally gone. It should be nice.

set.title: Pedaling Through Night Fog
set.description: Bike lanes clear of snow enable me to resume the ride to work and a more portable camera permits a few images of the dense fog we’ve experienced this week in Idaho’s Treasure Valley.

set.title: Laura’s First Time at Kirkham
set.description: Our eldest child Laura in town on holiday break from school at Washington State University seems a good reason to soak in our favorite hot spring, Kirkham, especially since Laura has never been there.

set.title: Climbing Shoofly Oolite
set.description: Jess and I with our two youngest travel to the southern edge of prehistoric Lake Idaho for a sunny walk around one of the world’s more unique environments.

set.title: Across Swan Falls Dam
set.description: Hunter and I explore a homestead and ancient petroglyphs along the Snake River across Swan Falls Dam. Heavy clouds darken the sky as we’re close to completing our arid loop. (Before you get excited, note this route is currently closed to motor vehicles.)

set.title: Atlanta Loop
set.description: Michael and I make a loop between Idaho City, Rocky Bar and Atlanta, Idaho, down forest roads, through a bit of snow, and finally ridge-top single track. It was a good thing he brought a saw or we might have missed “whoopty hell.” Video (1024x576): youtu.be/NaUUux08_0Q

set.title: Trails Around Deadwood
set.description: I am led by some guy I haven’t met before, Michael, down hours of mountain single track around Deadwood Reservoir. We start up to Bogus, through Placerville and Crouch before hitting narrow mountain trails I’d never ridden before — adventure as usual. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/J97JWhKxOas

set.title: Family Camp in Boulder Basin
set.description: Jessica, Hunter, Brenna and I head to Boulder Basin north of Ketchum, Idaho, to spend the night at 9,700 feet among the tailings and crumbling log cabins abandoned some sixty years since metals were last dug and dissolved from the high rock arena.

set.title: Brother Ride 2013: Long Road to Yoosa
set.description: Plans for an easygoing day go the way such plans usually do. We take an unexpected run at Windy Ridge and make an unexpected visit to one of our 2010 campsites. “Unexpected” is the word of the day. We conclude the day laughing around a fire under tall cedars. All’s well that ends well. Video (960x720): youtu.be/SzhMh5djnvs

set.title: Brother Ride 2013: Larch Butte Exposure
set.description: We are ready to ride, year six. We point our three motorcycles east from Pierce to Weitas Creek across forest roads and trails. What should be a short day of riding turns into something else. Video (960x720): youtu.be/S5kGlOTYtIg

set.title: Brother Ride 2013: A Night in Pierce
set.description: I haul two motorcycles — one for me, one for Jeremy — to Pierce, Idaho, starting point for the year’s Abbott Brother ride. I am there an evening in advance to secure our spot so I use the extra time to visit historic sites around the town.

set.title: Indomitable Boulder Basin
set.description: I camp two nights for a local club ride meant to climb the challenging trail to historic Boulder Basin near Sun Valley. There is camaraderie and beauty in the midst of defeat. Video (960x720): youtu.be/UGn6BUjW3Ws

set.title: Big Trinity Damsels
set.description: Brenna and I drive to the recently opened Trinity Recreation Area to camp along Big Trinity Lake and feed the mosquitoes. She swims, makes me a flower salad and map while I prepare the hotdogs and marshmallows. After a restless night we leave to the sunrise reflecting fire off placid waters.

set.title: Flowers Erupt From Lava Mountain
set.description: I go alone to follow narrow trails along unexplored Lava and perhaps Rattlesnake Mountains. I hope to reach North Star and Smith Creek Lakes seen on the map. The scenery is the best I know this close to home even as aches and pains remind me of my age. Video (960x720): youtu.be/RNzbzre4Mes

set.title: Seeking Gold in Silver City
set.description: Little Brenna and I take the doors off the Jeep for a drive to Idaho’s historic Silver City and the surrounding alpine mountains. On the way we stop at the Owyhee Museum in Murphy then begins our search for the gold we finally discover in the setting sun with only a minor loss of skin.

set.title: Asleep Along Eagleson
set.description: Hunter and I trailer to the Eighth Street trailhead then ride the rest of the way to the ridge and Eagleson for his first overnight trip off the motorcycle. We see a skink, sit around a fire, sleep and ride home through some difficult mental terrain. Video (960x720): youtu.be/3xxSpI0llOY

set.title: McCroskey Park Memorial Weekend
set.description: My brother Joel and I explore the ATV and single track trails around Skyline Drive in McCroskey State Park before setting up camp in view of Moscow Mountain. Video (960x720): youtu.be/2ypT99SUgCM

set.title: My Own Backyard: Boise Ridge Trails
set.description: I explore the hills next to town, up Trail 4, down Humpty and back on Eagleson and Rocky Canyon, looking for a place Hunter and I might do a quick overnight ride. Video (960x720): youtu.be/8TlB4PYrvgg

set.title: Hunter at Hemingway Butte
set.description: Hunter and I trailer our motorcycles to the Hemingway Butte riding area where we spend the afternoon improving our hill skills. Hunter does great, especially considering it’s only his second motorcycle ride. Video (960x720): youtu.be/JOj-VBOo_aA

set.title: Camping by Willow Creek
set.description: I ride over the hills to the Danskin area for my first overnight trip of the year and first time camping from the KTM. Luggage woes and difficult trails keep me from getting as far as planned but morning along Willow Creek makes it all worth it. Video (960x720): youtu.be/VAW7n2n2QxY

set.title: Our Son’s First Trail Ride
set.description: Video (960x720): youtu.be/obCgu3yJ4uw

set.title: Danskin on the New KTM
set.description: After a couple months parked in pieces in the garage, I finally get the new KTM out for a first dirt ride on the Danskin trails under patches of blue and between sheets of rain. The whoops are more pleasant than on the GS and the singletrack more inviting.

set.title: Long Road to Indian Hot Springs
set.description: Usually obscured by layers of rock and recollection, there are places where the history of land and people unfolds to reveal our own small place in the twining and termless chains of causality.

set.title: Ten Degrees at Kirkham
set.description: Jess and I with the two youngest, a mermaid and some Pringles head over the mountains hoping the Kirkham Hot Springs are just that — hot — in spite of the deep freeze that has settled over Idaho. We test some extremes of hot and cold.

set.title: Jordan Craters Christmas
set.description: While my brother Jesse and Jessica’s sister Amanda are visiting for Christmas, the boys go for some adventure in snow on lava.

set.title: Atlanta Thanksgiving 2012
set.description: Heather and Eric invite us up to the cabin in Atlanta, Idaho we’ve heard so much about while under construction these past many months. We are excited to see it and spend Thanksgiving together.

set.title: Trinity Ridge Fire Tour
set.description: A long loop with unknown impediments requires an early departure. Snow and fire kept us out of the Trinity Recreation area this year. I’m curious to see what remains. Some effort is required to push the GS uphill through snowdrifts.

set.title: Dagger Falls, I Freeze
set.description: I ride for an autumn night by myself near Idaho’s Sawtooth Mountains but am kept from my intended destination by wildfire. I find myself camped instead near an old fishway and falls along the Middle Fork of the Salmon, gateway to wilderness and “river of no return.” I spend the evening exploring on foot and the morning trying to warm up.

set.title: Hard Road to Boulder Basin
set.description: Jess and I narrowly avoid fire closures as we make our way north of Ketchum to spend the night high within historic Boulder Basin. The last five miles are quite challenging. They take longer than the first 200. It’s evening when finally we make it to the breathtaking basin. Video (853x480): youtu.be/30l2KuTewKk

set.title: Brother Ride 2012: Fire in the River
Brother Ride 2012: Made it to Montana
Oregon Trail to Pine and Back
set.description: We’ve struggled lately to find a weekend to ride but finally found a little time to head up toward Blacks Creek, along the Oregon Trail byway to Pine, back around Anderson Ranch Reservoir to Pierce then home. It was hot, about 90°F. It felt good to be in the wind.

set.title: Camping Below Trinity
set.description: Snow prevents us from reaching the Trinity lakes so we set up for a night along the cold creek below the lookout.

set.title: Jordan Craters in the Jeep
set.description: Having scouted it by motorcycle with my brother Joel, we decided our first Jeep camping trip would be near the historic Birch Creek homesteads along the Owyhee River.

set.title: Juntura by Desert
set.description: Tyson and I ride our big bikes through the desert from Boise to Juntura, Oregon with a gnarly stop in Dry Creek Gorge. Dinner at the Oasis caps a day that ends with us flying home on the darkened Interstate.

set.title: Alone in the Owyhees
set.description: Eager for a spring ride, I flew around in Google Earth and found a day-long route with highlights along the Owyhee Uplands Back Country Byway — an ancient shoreline, waterfall and big canyons.

set.title: Leslie Gulch to Birch Creek Camping
set.description: Our brother rides have been in North Idaho forests so it was time for different scenery. Joel and I were lucky to have good weather while visiting Succor Creek, Leslie Gulch, Birch Creek Historic Ranch and Jordan Craters.

set.title: Kirkham Hot Springs while it Snows
set.description: Jessica and I stopped here last fall when we motorcycled up for a night at the Sourdough Lodge. We knew the kids would love it. The tiny car, not so much.

set.title: Hike into Beaver Creek Cabin
set.description: Jessica and I plan a backwoods cabin getaway at the end of a short hike through snow north of Idaho City. It’s only two days after hernia surgery but I figure I can walk slowly. I didn’t anticipate needing to chop wood.

set.title: Snow on Coffee Lava
set.description: After seeing it alone while motorcycling, I knew the rest of the family would be excited to explore the peculiar landscape of Jordan Craters, made stranger by a skiff of snow.

set.title: KLR Club in the Owyhees
set.description: “Special” Ed leads four of us through his old stomping grounds along the Owyhee River and Reservoir. I’m the only one without a KLR. We find evidence related to a homicide and visit Leslie Gulch before I part from the group for an eerie night visit to Jordan Craters.

set.title: Wintry Backroads to Lowman
set.description: Jessica and I ride over the Boise Ridge, visit the museum in Placerville then have lunch in Garden Valley before attempting to summit Scott Mountain. Snow stops us but the effort means it’s dark by the time we reach Sourdough Lodge where we spend the night.

set.title: Brother Ride 2011: Bailout to Benewah
set.description: After yesterday’s trail troubles, we take the easy but long road from Elsie on our way to Crystal Lake only to find the final trail too narrow and steep for riding. With day’s end approaching, we hustle to find an acceptable alternative, finally settling in for a beautiful sunset over Benewah Lake.

set.title: Brother Ride 2011: Exercise and Elsie Lake
set.description: We see great country even as we face a day of dead-ends, one after another, trying to make our way to Wallace then Elsie Lake. Logging operations blocked three routes, sending us through the woods or miles around. It is nearly dark when we’re finally able to set up camp.

set.title: Brother Ride 2011: Tunnels to Loop Creek
set.description: From Crater Peak we venture to areas unknown around Monument Buttes before taking lunch in Avery and heading north of the St. Joe River for the first time. We ride through the several Moon Pass tunnels before staking a claim up Loop Creek.

set.title: Brother Ride 2011: Crater Peak
set.description: My brothers and I set out for our fourth annual motorcycle camping ride in the mountains of North Idaho. For the first day, we revisit our favorite subalpine ridge site behind Clarkia.

set.title: Panhandle Past and Future: Long Shadow Home
Panhandle Past and Future: Old House and School
Panhandle Past and Future: Rain in Laird Park
Panhandle Past and Future: Backroads with Laura
Hat Point above Hells Canyon
set.description: Greenhorn Ben joins me for an overnight ride along Hell’s Canyon on our way to North Idaho, me for a high school reunion and Ben to see family. We enjoy a beautiful view of the Seven Devils from our campsite on the lip of the canyon.

set.title: Grandma on the Big Dune
set.description: My mom and daughter joined me for an attempted hike around America's tallest free standing sand dune.

set.title: Zeno Falls on Ben
set.description: I meet up with a new rider, Ben, for a ride south across hills arid and unknown to us around Big Jacks Creek and beyond toward Nevada. We explore a homestead and Zeno Falls before struggling to find the route home.

set.title: Swan Falls but Once
set.description: A rare ride with Kayla to Initial Point then Swan Falls Dam and across the desolate Birds of Prey area to Grand View and much needed dinner at the Black Sands Resort along the C.J. Strike Reservoir. We only fall over once.

set.title: Indian Hot Springs
set.description: I join Phil, Ryan, Sam and Tyson for a little of Idaho’s Centennial Trail along the Bruneau and an overnight along hot springs. The road into the canyon conspires with morning snow to mean us harm.

set.title: Brenna’s First Walk Into Hulls Gulch
set.description: Brenna visited Upper Hulls Gulch when she was three days old. She seemed to like it. It seems just the thing to get her and all of us out of the house amidst grey winter days.

set.title: In a Mirror Darkly
set.description: I ride my bicycle through heavy fog along the Boise River towards an uncertain future in a somewhat obvious metaphor.

set.title: Reeds of Wood Duck Island
set.description: Warm and partly sunny January weather beckons us outdoors to traipse among the sticks and leaves along the river near our house.

set.title: Yellow Mist
set.description: I ride alongside river mist made molten by winter’s morning sun past sites once famous, the destination for thousands, now almost forgotten.

set.title: November Oranges
set.description: Another day of work, another day to ride. I stop in the place I often do along the river bank where it’s just me, leaves and water, and memories of summer revelers lining up to swing from a frayed rope into the river.

set.title: Sleeping on the Shore of Louie Lake
set.description: Ryan puts out a late season invitation for a night along the beautiful Louie Lake. About five of us answer the call to ride a couple hours north and climb the rocky trail to the lake’s edge where we sit around a fire and tell stories of old rides. After a wet and windy night we ride autumn-colored backroads by Yellow Pine to home.

set.title: Brother Ride 2010: Two Breakdowns
set.description: Tired of being cold and shot at, we spend a lazy morning along the Clearwater fishing and relaxing before heading homeward. I spend most of the next day brokedown atop Whitebird grade.

set.title: Brother Ride 2010: Thundersnow
set.description: We ride through snow and rain after trying to explore some single track in the Great Burn. Casey decides to leave for home but the rest of us continue to lightning, more snow and bullets going off in our fire.

set.title: Brother Ride 2010: Cayuse Creek
set.description: From Camp Martin we hit some highlights along the motorway before dropping down to Lochsa Lodge for food and gas. After an ice cream disappointment, we ride back over the ridge to Cayuse Creek where we set up camp. Late that night we get a strange visitor.

set.title: Brother Ride 2010: Camp Martin
set.description: My brothers and I — all four of this time — head out from Moscow, Idaho, for four nights along the trails Lewis and Clark followed about the same time of year in 1805. The GPS is tricky but we make it safely to historic Camp Martin.

set.title: Meeting Captain Bonneville
set.description: We ride east together, Hunter and I, across remnants of the Oregon Trail for a little visit to Bonneville Point, the historic site from which Boise was named. Hunter, though, is more interested in thorns and grasshoppers than history.

set.title: Three National Forests: Challis
set.description: We had been through the heat and it was time to get high as Jessica and I follow the Salmon River to gaze upon the mighty China Wall.

set.title: Three National Forests: Sawtooth
set.description: Jessica and I thread our way on the motorcycle along dirt roads by a buzz of wildfire activity on our way to find the next night’s lodging in view of the Sawtooth Mountains.

set.title: Three National Forests: Boise
set.description: We would see our highest recorded temperature and altitude on the motorcycle during our three days around the Stanley area. When plans to be at the Stanley Stomp Rally didn’t pan out, I thought the Stanley area would still be a nice August destination.

set.title: Wallowa Valley Rally: Out with a Bang
set.description: Our second and final night at the R.V. park in Enterprise Oregon is equal parts rain and good company.

set.title: Wallowa Valley Rally: Ryan Ride
set.description: Several rides were planned for Saturday depending on interest and riding style. Jessica and I had made no plans. Finding ourselves stumbling around with coffee cups early in the morning, we fell in with the “Steep and Rocky” crew who were trying to get an early start at a technical route. We were assured we’d probably be fine two-up. Perfect.

set.title: Wallowa Valley Rally: Being There
set.description: Jessica and I set up house along with fifty other motorcyclers at the R.V. park outside of Enterprise, Oregon.

set.title: Wallowa Valley Rally: Getting There
set.description: Jessica and I talked a few months earlier about joining Pacific Northwest adventure riders in Enterprise, Oregon near Hells Canyon for the fourth annual weekend of riding and camaraderie organized by Sherry, ADVrider “Ladybug.” But somehow the plan didn’t make its way onto our ride calendar. When we realized it was the next week, we scrambled to arrange time off from work and babysitting for our two-year-old. We weren’t positive we’d be able to go until nearly the day of departure. Planning the adventure was itself an adventure!

set.title: Making Art in Tuscarora: Going Home
set.description: Laura and I hasten but fail to beat a storm as we head homeward, stopping twice for shelter, making memories sure to last a lifetime.

set.title: Making Art in Tuscarora: In the Mountains
set.description: While the Tuscarora art students are busy with projects, I take a day to explore the expanse of mountains I saw from the ridge above town.

set.title: Making Art in Tuscarora: In the Hills
set.description: At first with Laura and then on my own I explore the hills immediately above Tuscarora. Brown and featureless from a distance, I find up close they’re decorated with an impressive variety of colorful flora.

set.title: Making Art in Tuscarora: The Town
set.description: We arrive early in Tuscarora, Laura and I, and bide our time exploring the small town and its environs. When the other students arrive, I document some of their projects and look more closely at items on display at the pottery school.

set.title: Making Art in Tuscarora: Getting There
set.description: Laura and I ride together on the GS from home south into Nevada on our way to tiny Tuscarora for a high school trip. We stop to sleep at Wild Horse Crossing campground before continuing through mountains and across desert to our destination.

set.title: Jump Creek and Leslie Gulch
set.description: Jessica and I ride together on the GS to Jump Creek Falls then overland to Leslie Gulch where we explore fantastic rock formations and camp for the night. We return by way of Succor Creek.

set.title: Troy Days and Moscow Mountain
set.description: I ride the GS1200 north from sweltering Boise to Moscow to visit family and my hometown Troy Days. Later, my brothers and I ride some singletrack on Moscow Mountain before celebrating my nephew’s seventh birthday.

set.title: Rain on Mud Flat Road
set.description: Sam leads three of us on a day-ride around the Owhyee Uplands Back Country Byway. We encounter a little weather at the highest altitudes while Toni and Heath on their smaller bikes pursue a more exploratory route. They show up later muddy and disheveled.

set.title: Mayfield, Skull Rock, Y-Stop
set.description: Jessica and I meet again with some thirty fine members of the Idaho Adventure Motorcycle Club for breakfast at Rockie’s Diner before being led by Sam by Bonneville Point past Mayfield and Skull Rock for lunch in Pine, Idaho. From there we split up to return by different routes.

set.title: Purple Morning Majesty
set.description: The morning provides a proper coronation at the usual spot while a jester in the guise of a fox watches from the bushes. What does the fox say?

set.title: Freezing Fog on the River
set.description: Another in a series of impressive sunrises compels me to pause on my way to work and watch the interplay of billowing fog and beams of light.

set.title: Minus Six by the River
set.description: It is that special time of year when temperatures drop to single digits and mist rises from the frigid river into golden morning light. I don’t want to lose my warmth but I’m compelled to pause and admire the ice and light.

set.title: Brother Ride 2009: Crater Peak Reunion
set.description: My brothers and I are pleased to find last year’s primitive campsite largely intact and set about making improvements for the expected years to come while storm clouds play across the wide horizon until rain drives us into our tents.

set.title: Brother Ride 2009: Rain in Avery
set.description: The expected night storm is delayed until morning as we depart Lost Lake in a drizzle for whatever shelter we might find in Avery, Idaho. After that pit-stop, we explore some mountains before pointing toward our final blissful campsite.

set.title: Brother Ride 2009: Lost Lake Crawdads
set.description: From Marble Creek we make the short but somewhat technical trek to Lost Lake where we find another perfect campsite, marred only by an afternoon flash mob and prehistoric lake inhabitants. A predicted storm inspires Jesse to dig a canal system around his tent.

set.title: Brother Ride 2009: Bright Moon at Marble Creek
set.description: My brothers and I join forces a second time to ride with a friend Casey from home base in Moscow, Idaho to an idyllic spot along Marble Creek in the St. Joe Ranger District where we probe the mysteries of MREs and revel at a preternaturally bright moon.

set.title: One Day, Three Peaks
set.description: Jessica and I ride together on the GS1200 with a few of the Idaho Motorcycle Club crew to Pilot Peak, Sunset Mountain summit and Jackson Peak, then we take off on our own for a little exploration, discovering one of the rare Idaho Moai.

set.title: Circumnavigating Oahu
set.description: I suppose if you’re a very technical person you might not think Hawai’i can be part of an Idaho Adventure. But through a twist of fate, we did encounter a significant part of Idaho during our time circling the small island of Oahu.

set.title: Light Painting Kuna Cave
set.description: Hunter and I having scouted it first, the ladies decide to join us for another foray into the dark and dusty Kuna Cave.

set.title: Boise Ridge With the boy
set.description: Hunter joins me on the GS for a short ride to the Boise Ridge, including the top of Trail Four, and back.

set.title: Brother Ride 2008: Cold Ride Home
set.description: We retreat early from the cold and wet mountains for the warmth of home before I speed to Boise on winding Idaho highways.

set.title: Brother Ride 2008: Camping with Cows
set.description: Led astray by evolving, unmarked forest roads, and trying to beat the rain, we end up bovine bedfellows, one of us nursing an injury.

set.title: Brother Ride 2008: Party on Crater Peak
set.description: My brothers and I ride for the first time as adults to camp in the mountains of the St. Joe Ranger District that we remember fondly from childhood.

set.title: Unholy Trinity
set.description: My oldest daughter Laura and I ride together on the GS1200 through Smith Prairie for Trinity Lookout only to be yelled at when we arrive. We return through Featherville, not getting home until late at night.

set.title: Arrowrock to Thorn Creek Butte
set.description: Jessica and I ride together with a club we just learned about up Blacks Creek to the Y-Stop, over to Arrowrock then up to Thorn Creek Butte before an ice cream stop (thanks Sam) in Idaho City.

set.title: Troy Days, Beers and Bears
set.description: I ride north from the sweltering heat to attend Troy Days and ride with my brother Jesse around the forested mountains.

set.title: Finding Kuna Cave
set.description: Having lately visited my first lava tube cave near Shoshone, Idaho, a friend and I decide to investigate the close-by Kuna Cave.

set.title: Snake River Day
set.description: I have noticed Swan Falls dam several times during flight lessons, just minutes from the airport, and have been wanting to drive down to check it out. A sunny spring day seemed a good time to finally explore.

set.title: Ice Flows on the River
set.description: It isn’t often that ice forms on the river through Boise so I stop a few times on my way to work for a better look.

set.title: Muddy Walk on the Oregon Trail
set.description: Hunter and I set out with his bicycle in the bed of the truck to explore some of the Oregon Trail above the Boise River near our house.

set.title: Lucky Peak with Laura
set.description: My daughter Laura rides along on the XR 650L while we seek the elusive southern route from Aldape to Lucky Peak. We also try to make our way to an old mine I once encountered near Highway 21.

set.title: Malad Gorge Attitudes
set.description: We have hit Shoshone Falls a couple times and the Indian Ice Cave so this Twin Falls mid-trip adventure, to beat the desert drive doldrums, is Malad Gorge.

set.title: Ice Cave Dinosaur Ride
set.description: A little look-see on the internet suggests we might break the monotony of four Interstate 84 hours with a stop at a famous ice cave not far off the freeway. I’m not sure what an ice cave is but it sounds intriguing.

set.title: Cricket Ridge Ride
set.description: My daughter Laura and I ride together on my XR 650L up Rocky Canyon Road, across the Boise Ridge for a small loop around the top of Trail 4, above Hulls Gulch, then return the same way as the sun sets. Along the way we encounter our old friend, the ostentatious Mormon Cricket. Video (640x480): youtu.be/qk-gAfTO7LU

set.title: Dirt Biking Boise Ridge
set.description: I join Ely from work and a couple of his riding buddies for a dirt loop around the Boise Ridge. A few obstacles along the way ensure entertainment.

set.title: Spring Caterpillars on the Boise Ridge
Autumn Creek on the Boise Ridge
Autumn Ride to Boise
set.description: Weather had been unusually nice and my friend Greg Bunce had some business in Boise so, at his prompting, we decided to make it a weekend motorcycle trip from our homes in Moscow, Idaho. I would hang out with my childhood friend Brett, who’d moved there a few years earlier, while Greg was busy. At the time, I worked at the University of Idaho computer store and so had access to demonstration units of some of the first-ever consumer digital cameras, such as the Apple QuickTake and Casio QV-10. I used them quite a bit — so cool to see the photos right on our computer monitors! What we didn’t see comparing our fourteen-inch screens to 4 × 6 prints was just how much quality was lost compared to film. It’s almost tragic but I guess also a bit of history. These were probably shot on the QV-10. Its images were less than one-tenth of a megapixel (320 × 240).

set.title: Widow Peak Senior Picture
set.description: Although several years and many rides preceded this one, I think this is the oldest (the exact date is an educated guess) of which I have pictures, a quest for high school senior photos in the mountains above Clarkia, Idaho.

collection.title: Where
collection.description: In what state or kind of terrain did it happen

set.title: Overnight on Hunter’s Knoll
set.description: You can’t keep us indoors with Jessica once again away. I let the kids vote (probably a mistake) on an hour drive or three with our resulting sights set on an overnight among the trees overlooking Boise. At least we won’t end up stuck in big mountain snow. Or will we?

set.title: Lava, Rattlesnake and Devil Creeks
set.description: An idea to ride overnight in the Upper Reynolds Creek area gave way to a simpler day ride to check on my old friend Lava Mountain and see if I could connect from there across Bear Gulch for a half-day of riding single track by myself. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/pRWEHQsYYek

set.title: Willow Creek Campground
set.description: Jessica is out of town. You know what that calls for! Camping. Since she’ll have the Jeep, we’ll make due with campground camping we can reach with the baby hippo car. I’ve always liked the look of a few spots above Arrowrock Reservoir so we set our heading accordingly. Engage!

set.title: Atlanta Thanksgiving 2014
set.description: It was down to the wire whether our Thanksgiving with Heather, Eric and kids could be at their cabin in Atlanta, Idaho. Record breaking November snowfall left the sixty mile mountain dirt road impassable. But a quick melt has things back on track. Or so it seems.

set.title: Brother Ride 2014: Scott Mountain
set.description: The first day of our seventh annual Abbott Brother Ride, this time, for the first time, in South Central Idaho. We stage at my house then head over the Boise Ridge, from desert to forest, on our way to high mountains. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/dXexasadjZQ

set.title: Switchbacks to Goat Lake
set.description: Michael and I ride from Boise through Prairie and across the mountains to Pine and Featherville before turning north to camp around a high mountain lake. We cover highway, gravel, dirt roads, ATV and singletrack, a real dual sport adventure. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/D25IrwB0mOA

set.title: Atlanta Loop
set.description: Michael and I make a loop between Idaho City, Rocky Bar and Atlanta, Idaho, down forest roads, through a bit of snow, and finally ridge-top single track. It was a good thing he brought a saw or we might have missed “whoopty hell.” Video (1024x576): youtu.be/NaUUux08_0Q

set.title: Trails Around Deadwood
set.description: I am led by some guy I haven’t met before, Michael, down hours of mountain single track around Deadwood Reservoir. We start up to Bogus, through Placerville and Crouch before hitting narrow mountain trails I’d never ridden before — adventure as usual. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/J97JWhKxOas

set.title: Flowers Erupt From Lava Mountain
set.description: I go alone to follow narrow trails along unexplored Lava and perhaps Rattlesnake Mountains. I hope to reach North Star and Smith Creek Lakes seen on the map. The scenery is the best I know this close to home even as aches and pains remind me of my age. Video (960x720): youtu.be/RNzbzre4Mes

set.title: Asleep Along Eagleson
set.description: Hunter and I trailer to the Eighth Street trailhead then ride the rest of the way to the ridge and Eagleson for his first overnight trip off the motorcycle. We see a skink, sit around a fire, sleep and ride home through some difficult mental terrain. Video (960x720): youtu.be/3xxSpI0llOY

set.title: My Own Backyard: Boise Ridge Trails
set.description: I explore the hills next to town, up Trail 4, down Humpty and back on Eagleson and Rocky Canyon, looking for a place Hunter and I might do a quick overnight ride. Video (960x720): youtu.be/8TlB4PYrvgg

set.title: Camping by Willow Creek
set.description: I ride over the hills to the Danskin area for my first overnight trip of the year and first time camping from the KTM. Luggage woes and difficult trails keep me from getting as far as planned but morning along Willow Creek makes it all worth it. Video (960x720): youtu.be/VAW7n2n2QxY

set.title: Atlanta Thanksgiving 2012
set.description: Heather and Eric invite us up to the cabin in Atlanta, Idaho we’ve heard so much about while under construction these past many months. We are excited to see it and spend Thanksgiving together.

set.title: Trinity Ridge Fire Tour
set.description: A long loop with unknown impediments requires an early departure. Snow and fire kept us out of the Trinity Recreation area this year. I’m curious to see what remains. Some effort is required to push the GS uphill through snowdrifts.

set.title: Oregon Trail to Pine and Back
set.description: We’ve struggled lately to find a weekend to ride but finally found a little time to head up toward Blacks Creek, along the Oregon Trail byway to Pine, back around Anderson Ranch Reservoir to Pierce then home. It was hot, about 90°F. It felt good to be in the wind.

set.title: One Day, Three Peaks
set.description: Jessica and I ride together on the GS1200 with a few of the Idaho Motorcycle Club crew to Pilot Peak, Sunset Mountain summit and Jackson Peak, then we take off on our own for a little exploration, discovering one of the rare Idaho Moai.

set.title: Hunter Rides Daggett
set.description: Hunter leads us up Rocky Canyon to the Boise Ridge and a great campsite he finds near Deer Point. The next morning, in spite of a warning, he decides to brave Daggett Creek.

set.title: Spring Caterpillars on the Boise Ridge
Autumn Creek on the Boise Ridge
Spring Fish & Chips
set.description: Brenna, Jessica and I spend a sunny spring afternoon bicycling Boise’s Greenbelt along the river through six parks with a pitstop at Joe’s Crabshack to grease the wheels.

set.title: Until the Fog Lifts
set.description: I spent an afternoon planning a winter 2016 motorcycle loop but thought better of it as I noticed the mud I’ve been pedaling through to work. So I made a word salad about mud.

set.title: Willow Creek Campground
set.description: Jessica is out of town. You know what that calls for! Camping. Since she’ll have the Jeep, we’ll make due with campground camping we can reach with the baby hippo car. I’ve always liked the look of a few spots above Arrowrock Reservoir so we set our heading accordingly. Engage!

set.title: Light December Snow
set.description: The last two days of 2014 are dusted with snow and colored with sun, a dichotomy I’m glad to indulge with several stops while biking to and from my office downtown. May the new year be so beautiful.

set.title: Ten Degrees Too Early
set.description: Winter came a month early. I enjoy the blanket of sparkling white and added challenge of biking a slippery path. It sure would have been great to rake the leaves up first, though. Oh well. The fiery fog and glowing hoar frost are beautiful just the same.

set.title: Cotton Candy After a Wood Duck Walk
set.description: We must make the most of our favorite season, walks and rides, fast and furious, before the last leaf falls. We park in Bown Crossing near Brenna’s school for an evening walk along the river before sitting to dinner and perhaps a treat.

set.title: Home Along the River
set.description: The sharp morning light of a week ago is today muted by mist rolling off the cold water along my bicycle commute to work. Lucky for me, this common autumn scene never fails to delight and I’m glad for the chance to meander.

set.title: Election Leaves
set.description: Political outcomes won’t change it: things that brought joy yesterday are those which bring joy today — full suspension bunny-hop from asphalt to dirt, glittering leaves and deep breaths of cold air.

set.title: Riverside With My Hula Girl
set.description: She was so excited by the prospect of a simple walk by the river, how could I say no. So after days of intermittent rain, Brenna and I spend two hours walking the familiar paths near home. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/ZWt0rWaPpS8

set.title: Winter Sticks and Bridges
set.description: Feeling cooped up on a cold weekend while Jessica is away, I suggest a walk along the river. The inversion is finally gone. It should be nice.

set.title: Pedaling Through Night Fog
set.description: Bike lanes clear of snow enable me to resume the ride to work and a more portable camera permits a few images of the dense fog we’ve experienced this week in Idaho’s Treasure Valley.

set.title: In a Mirror Darkly
set.description: I ride my bicycle through heavy fog along the Boise River towards an uncertain future in a somewhat obvious metaphor.

set.title: Yellow Mist
set.description: I ride alongside river mist made molten by winter’s morning sun past sites once famous, the destination for thousands, now almost forgotten.

set.title: November Oranges
set.description: Another day of work, another day to ride. I stop in the place I often do along the river bank where it’s just me, leaves and water, and memories of summer revelers lining up to swing from a frayed rope into the river.

set.title: Purple Morning Majesty
set.description: The morning provides a proper coronation at the usual spot while a jester in the guise of a fox watches from the bushes. What does the fox say?

set.title: Freezing Fog on the River
set.description: Another in a series of impressive sunrises compels me to pause on my way to work and watch the interplay of billowing fog and beams of light.

set.title: Minus Six by the River
set.description: It is that special time of year when temperatures drop to single digits and mist rises from the frigid river into golden morning light. I don’t want to lose my warmth but I’m compelled to pause and admire the ice and light.

set.title: Ice Flows on the River
set.description: It isn’t often that ice forms on the river through Boise so I stop a few times on my way to work for a better look.

set.title: Trinity Ridge Fire Tour
set.description: A long loop with unknown impediments requires an early departure. Snow and fire kept us out of the Trinity Recreation area this year. I’m curious to see what remains. Some effort is required to push the GS uphill through snowdrifts.

set.title: Meeting Captain Bonneville
set.description: We ride east together, Hunter and I, across remnants of the Oregon Trail for a little visit to Bonneville Point, the historic site from which Boise was named. Hunter, though, is more interested in thorns and grasshoppers than history.

set.title: Mayfield, Skull Rock, Y-Stop
set.description: Jessica and I meet again with some thirty fine members of the Idaho Adventure Motorcycle Club for breakfast at Rockie’s Diner before being led by Sam by Bonneville Point past Mayfield and Skull Rock for lunch in Pine, Idaho. From there we split up to return by different routes.

collection.title: Bruneau
collection.description: The Bruneau Canyon, River (a Tributary to the Snake) and areas nearby

set.title: Long Road to Indian Hot Springs
set.description: Usually obscured by layers of rock and recollection, there are places where the history of land and people unfolds to reveal our own small place in the twining and termless chains of causality.

set.title: Grandma on the Big Dune
set.description: My mom and daughter joined me for an attempted hike around America's tallest free standing sand dune.

set.title: Indian Hot Springs
set.description: I join Phil, Ryan, Sam and Tyson for a little of Idaho’s Centennial Trail along the Bruneau and an overnight along hot springs. The road into the canyon conspires with morning snow to mean us harm.

set.title: Boulder Basin Team Building
set.description: Boulder Basin came to mind when the need for a getaway arose. It’s about as far removed from civilization as you can get in an automobile around here, enough of a trip that you’d best plan on spending the night. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/8mieqdlWR0E

set.title: Indomitable Boulder Basin
set.description: I camp two nights for a local club ride meant to climb the challenging trail to historic Boulder Basin near Sun Valley. There is camaraderie and beauty in the midst of defeat. Video (960x720): youtu.be/UGn6BUjW3Ws

set.title: Family Camp in Boulder Basin
set.description: Jessica, Hunter, Brenna and I head to Boulder Basin north of Ketchum, Idaho, to spend the night at 9,700 feet among the tailings and crumbling log cabins abandoned some sixty years since metals were last dug and dissolved from the high rock arena.

set.title: Hard Road to Boulder Basin
set.description: Jess and I narrowly avoid fire closures as we make our way north of Ketchum to spend the night high within historic Boulder Basin. The last five miles are quite challenging. They take longer than the first 200. It’s evening when finally we make it to the breathtaking basin. Video (853x480): youtu.be/30l2KuTewKk

set.title: Danskin November
set.description: With special dispensation from Jessica, I hastily changed oil, cleaned the chain and otherwise prepared the bike for what may be the last ride of 2015. I rode hard until dark, meeting along the way fiddling friends, Mickey and Moose, for whom are named popular flats above the South Fork of the Boise River.

set.title: Camping by Willow Creek
set.description: I ride over the hills to the Danskin area for my first overnight trip of the year and first time camping from the KTM. Luggage woes and difficult trails keep me from getting as far as planned but morning along Willow Creek makes it all worth it. Video (960x720): youtu.be/VAW7n2n2QxY

set.title: Our Son’s First Trail Ride
set.description: Video (960x720): youtu.be/obCgu3yJ4uw

set.title: Danskin on the New KTM
set.description: After a couple months parked in pieces in the garage, I finally get the new KTM out for a first dirt ride on the Danskin trails under patches of blue and between sheets of rain. The whoops are more pleasant than on the GS and the singletrack more inviting.

set.title: Light Painting Kuna Cave
set.description: Hunter and I having scouted it first, the ladies decide to join us for another foray into the dark and dusty Kuna Cave.

set.title: Finding Kuna Cave
set.description: Having lately visited my first lava tube cave near Shoshone, Idaho, a friend and I decide to investigate the close-by Kuna Cave.

set.title: Ice Cave Dinosaur Ride
set.description: A little look-see on the internet suggests we might break the monotony of four Interstate 84 hours with a stop at a famous ice cave not far off the freeway. I’m not sure what an ice cave is but it sounds intriguing.

set.title: Hat Point above Hells Canyon
set.description: Greenhorn Ben joins me for an overnight ride along Hell’s Canyon on our way to North Idaho, me for a high school reunion and Ben to see family. We enjoy a beautiful view of the Seven Devils from our campsite on the lip of the canyon.

set.title: Wallowa Valley Rally: Out with a Bang
set.description: Our second and final night at the R.V. park in Enterprise Oregon is equal parts rain and good company.

set.title: Wallowa Valley Rally: Ryan Ride
set.description: Several rides were planned for Saturday depending on interest and riding style. Jessica and I had made no plans. Finding ourselves stumbling around with coffee cups early in the morning, we fell in with the “Steep and Rocky” crew who were trying to get an early start at a technical route. We were assured we’d probably be fine two-up. Perfect.

set.title: Wallowa Valley Rally: Being There
set.description: Jessica and I set up house along with fifty other motorcyclers at the R.V. park outside of Enterprise, Oregon.

set.title: Wallowa Valley Rally: Getting There
set.description: Jessica and I talked a few months earlier about joining Pacific Northwest adventure riders in Enterprise, Oregon near Hells Canyon for the fourth annual weekend of riding and camaraderie organized by Sherry, ADVrider “Ladybug.” But somehow the plan didn’t make its way onto our ride calendar. When we realized it was the next week, we scrambled to arrange time off from work and babysitting for our two-year-old. We weren’t positive we’d be able to go until nearly the day of departure. Planning the adventure was itself an adventure!

set.title: Laura’s First Time at Kirkham
set.description: Our eldest child Laura in town on holiday break from school at Washington State University seems a good reason to soak in our favorite hot spring, Kirkham, especially since Laura has never been there.

set.title: Long Road to Indian Hot Springs
set.description: Usually obscured by layers of rock and recollection, there are places where the history of land and people unfolds to reveal our own small place in the twining and termless chains of causality.

set.title: Ten Degrees at Kirkham
set.description: Jess and I with the two youngest, a mermaid and some Pringles head over the mountains hoping the Kirkham Hot Springs are just that — hot — in spite of the deep freeze that has settled over Idaho. We test some extremes of hot and cold.

set.title: Kirkham Hot Springs while it Snows
set.description: Jessica and I stopped here last fall when we motorcycled up for a night at the Sourdough Lodge. We knew the kids would love it. The tiny car, not so much.

set.title: Wintry Backroads to Lowman
set.description: Jessica and I ride over the Boise Ridge, visit the museum in Placerville then have lunch in Garden Valley before attempting to summit Scott Mountain. Snow stops us but the effort means it’s dark by the time we reach Sourdough Lodge where we spend the night.

set.title: Indian Hot Springs
set.description: I join Phil, Ryan, Sam and Tyson for a little of Idaho’s Centennial Trail along the Bruneau and an overnight along hot springs. The road into the canyon conspires with morning snow to mean us harm.

set.title: March in Lower Hulls Gulch
set.description: Working on pictures of a previous Hulls Gulch walk brought it to mind. It’s been a few years since we visited. A beautiful, sunny weekend beckons.

set.title: Cricket Ridge Ride
set.description: My daughter Laura and I ride together on my XR 650L up Rocky Canyon Road, across the Boise Ridge for a small loop around the top of Trail 4, above Hulls Gulch, then return the same way as the sun sets. Along the way we encounter our old friend, the ostentatious Mormon Cricket. Video (640x480): youtu.be/qk-gAfTO7LU

set.title: Brenna’s First Walk Into Hulls Gulch
set.description: Brenna visited Upper Hulls Gulch when she was three days old. She seemed to like it. It seems just the thing to get her and all of us out of the house amidst grey winter days.

set.title: Jordan Craters Christmas
set.description: While my brother Jesse and Jessica’s sister Amanda are visiting for Christmas, the boys go for some adventure in snow on lava.

set.title: Leslie Gulch to Birch Creek Camping
set.description: Our brother rides have been in North Idaho forests so it was time for different scenery. Joel and I were lucky to have good weather while visiting Succor Creek, Leslie Gulch, Birch Creek Historic Ranch and Jordan Craters.

set.title: Jordan Craters in the Jeep
set.description: Having scouted it by motorcycle with my brother Joel, we decided our first Jeep camping trip would be near the historic Birch Creek homesteads along the Owyhee River.

set.title: Snow on Coffee Lava
set.description: After seeing it alone while motorcycling, I knew the rest of the family would be excited to explore the peculiar landscape of Jordan Craters, made stranger by a skiff of snow.

set.title: KLR Club in the Owyhees
set.description: “Special” Ed leads four of us through his old stomping grounds along the Owyhee River and Reservoir. I’m the only one without a KLR. We find evidence related to a homicide and visit Leslie Gulch before I part from the group for an eerie night visit to Jordan Craters.

set.title: Three Prong Approach to Jump Creek
set.description: After running through some options to break the television-watching rain routine, we settle on the forty-five minute drive to Jump Creek Falls, what some call a “locals’” attraction because of unclear, zig-zag access through private pastures and occasional use by teen revelers.

set.title: Jump Creek and Leslie Gulch
set.description: Jessica and I ride together on the GS to Jump Creek Falls then overland to Leslie Gulch where we explore fantastic rock formations and camp for the night. We return by way of Succor Creek.

set.title: McCroskey to Bald Mountain
set.description: Jeremy and I travel from our homes to Farmington, Washington, for some quick riding with our brother Joel around our childhood stomping grounds north of Moscow Mountain.

set.title: Panhandle Past and Future: Rain in Laird Park
Juniper Gulch Hike
set.description: Wherein I hike with three young ladies among swoopdongles and bibbelty bobs amidst the litterbox smell of blue-berried junipers.

set.title: Leslie Gulch to Birch Creek Camping
set.description: Our brother rides have been in North Idaho forests so it was time for different scenery. Joel and I were lucky to have good weather while visiting Succor Creek, Leslie Gulch, Birch Creek Historic Ranch and Jordan Craters.

set.title: KLR Club in the Owyhees
set.description: “Special” Ed leads four of us through his old stomping grounds along the Owyhee River and Reservoir. I’m the only one without a KLR. We find evidence related to a homicide and visit Leslie Gulch before I part from the group for an eerie night visit to Jordan Craters.

set.title: Jump Creek and Leslie Gulch
set.description: Jessica and I ride together on the GS to Jump Creek Falls then overland to Leslie Gulch where we explore fantastic rock formations and camp for the night. We return by way of Succor Creek.

set.title: Chalk and Basalt
set.description: Brilliant but cool autumn days beckon. Jessica, Hunter, Brenna and I drove south to explore again the Lake Idaho seabed, hoping for treasures emotional and material.

set.title: Little Brenna at Little Jacks Creek
set.description: She has been asking about it almost daily for weeks and finally we’re making it happen, a camp out for just Brenna and me. I liked what I saw last week motorcycling around Little Jacks Creek so that’s where we are headed with hot dogs, marshmallows and our best hiking flip-flops.

set.title: Oreana and Little Jacks Creek
set.description: Per my usual process for a solo ride, I pan around Google Earth looking to see things I haven’t seen, consult with the Idaho Trails site and finally lay out a route in the GPS software. It works great thirty percent of the time.

set.title: Kuna Cave Fails to Impress
set.description: I have had my fill of the place but I think Brenna might find Kuna Cave a fun adventure so her and Hunter join me in the little car for the short drive to dusty spelunking while Jessica is busy with meetings.

set.title: Light Painting Kuna Cave
set.description: Hunter and I having scouted it first, the ladies decide to join us for another foray into the dark and dusty Kuna Cave.

set.title: Finding Kuna Cave
set.description: Having lately visited my first lava tube cave near Shoshone, Idaho, a friend and I decide to investigate the close-by Kuna Cave.

set.title: McCroskey Park Memorial Weekend
set.description: My brother Joel and I explore the ATV and single track trails around Skyline Drive in McCroskey State Park before setting up camp in view of Moscow Mountain. Video (960x720): youtu.be/2ypT99SUgCM

set.title: Troy Days and Moscow Mountain
set.description: I ride the GS1200 north from sweltering Boise to Moscow to visit family and my hometown Troy Days. Later, my brothers and I ride some singletrack on Moscow Mountain before celebrating my nephew’s seventh birthday.

set.title: Troy Days, Beers and Bears
set.description: I ride north from the sweltering heat to attend Troy Days and ride with my brother Jesse around the forested mountains.

set.title: Malad Gorge Attitudes
set.description: We have hit Shoshone Falls a couple times and the Indian Ice Cave so this Twin Falls mid-trip adventure, to beat the desert drive doldrums, is Malad Gorge.

set.title: Making Art in Tuscarora: Going Home
set.description: Laura and I hasten but fail to beat a storm as we head homeward, stopping twice for shelter, making memories sure to last a lifetime.

set.title: Making Art in Tuscarora: In the Mountains
set.description: While the Tuscarora art students are busy with projects, I take a day to explore the expanse of mountains I saw from the ridge above town.

set.title: Making Art in Tuscarora: In the Hills
set.description: At first with Laura and then on my own I explore the hills immediately above Tuscarora. Brown and featureless from a distance, I find up close they’re decorated with an impressive variety of colorful flora.

set.title: Making Art in Tuscarora: The Town
set.description: We arrive early in Tuscarora, Laura and I, and bide our time exploring the small town and its environs. When the other students arrive, I document some of their projects and look more closely at items on display at the pottery school.

set.title: Making Art in Tuscarora: Getting There
set.description: Laura and I ride together on the GS from home south into Nevada on our way to tiny Tuscarora for a high school trip. We stop to sleep at Wild Horse Crossing campground before continuing through mountains and across desert to our destination.

set.title: Three Fingers Gulch
set.description: Michael and I ride from Succor Creek Road through the Oregon Owyhees in an eighty mile loop around Three Fingers Butte.

set.title: Jordan Craters Christmas
set.description: While my brother Jesse and Jessica’s sister Amanda are visiting for Christmas, the boys go for some adventure in snow on lava.

set.title: Leslie Gulch to Birch Creek Camping
set.description: Our brother rides have been in North Idaho forests so it was time for different scenery. Joel and I were lucky to have good weather while visiting Succor Creek, Leslie Gulch, Birch Creek Historic Ranch and Jordan Craters.

set.title: Alone in the Owyhees
set.description: Eager for a spring ride, I flew around in Google Earth and found a day-long route with highlights along the Owyhee Uplands Back Country Byway — an ancient shoreline, waterfall and big canyons.

set.title: Jordan Craters in the Jeep
set.description: Having scouted it by motorcycle with my brother Joel, we decided our first Jeep camping trip would be near the historic Birch Creek homesteads along the Owyhee River.

set.title: Snow on Coffee Lava
set.description: After seeing it alone while motorcycling, I knew the rest of the family would be excited to explore the peculiar landscape of Jordan Craters, made stranger by a skiff of snow.

set.title: Juntura by Desert
set.description: Tyson and I ride our big bikes through the desert from Boise to Juntura, Oregon with a gnarly stop in Dry Creek Gorge. Dinner at the Oasis caps a day that ends with us flying home on the darkened Interstate.

set.title: Hat Point above Hells Canyon
set.description: Greenhorn Ben joins me for an overnight ride along Hell’s Canyon on our way to North Idaho, me for a high school reunion and Ben to see family. We enjoy a beautiful view of the Seven Devils from our campsite on the lip of the canyon.

set.title: KLR Club in the Owyhees
set.description: “Special” Ed leads four of us through his old stomping grounds along the Owyhee River and Reservoir. I’m the only one without a KLR. We find evidence related to a homicide and visit Leslie Gulch before I part from the group for an eerie night visit to Jordan Craters.

set.title: Jump Creek and Leslie Gulch
set.description: Jessica and I ride together on the GS to Jump Creek Falls then overland to Leslie Gulch where we explore fantastic rock formations and camp for the night. We return by way of Succor Creek.

set.title: Rain on Mud Flat Road
set.description: Sam leads three of us on a day-ride around the Owhyee Uplands Back Country Byway. We encounter a little weather at the highest altitudes while Toni and Heath on their smaller bikes pursue a more exploratory route. They show up later muddy and disheveled.

set.title: Swan Falls Dam to Wilson Creek via Murphy
set.description: Michael and I take advantage of unseasonably warm February weather to explore roads and histories south of the Snake River. [ Addendum: I’ve added images at the end showing some motorized restrictions we overlooked during the ride. Plan accordingly. ] Video (1024x576): youtu.be/tDENDkPm6Dc

set.title: Muddy Walk on the Oregon Trail
set.description: Hunter and I set out with his bicycle in the bed of the truck to explore some of the Oregon Trail above the Boise River near our house.

set.title: Chalk and Basalt
set.description: Brilliant but cool autumn days beckon. Jessica, Hunter, Brenna and I drove south to explore again the Lake Idaho seabed, hoping for treasures emotional and material.

set.title: Swan Falls Dam to Wilson Creek via Murphy
set.description: Michael and I take advantage of unseasonably warm February weather to explore roads and histories south of the Snake River. [ Addendum: I’ve added images at the end showing some motorized restrictions we overlooked during the ride. Plan accordingly. ] Video (1024x576): youtu.be/tDENDkPm6Dc

set.title: Autumn Camping Above Silver City
set.description: Something we’ve said we’d do for a while now, we load the kids up to visit Silver City then camp somewhere in the hills above. It was near freezing when I camped with my brothers recently but it seems warmer now. I hope so.

set.title: Birch Creek Sandcastle
set.description: Keeping to the recent pattern, we drive south with the kids to camp at a place in the Owyhees I reconnoitered by motorcycle, stopping along the way to see the Owyhee Museum in Murphy.

set.title: Owyhee Snow and Sand: Lowlands
set.description: From my secret campsite behind Silver City (disregarding the GPS track), I descend Bachman Grade to explore some lesser known canyons within the Owyhee Front. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/WYvg5VV3T8E

set.title: Owyhee Snow and Sand: Uplands
set.description: I ride across the Snake up Reynolds Creek to explore roads and routes I’ve not seen before camping somewhere in the mountains behind Silver City. Video (1024x576): youtu.be/U8Y5rBOhz0s

set.title: Three Fingers Gulch
set.description: Michael and I ride from Succor Creek Road through the Oregon Owyhees in an eighty mile loop around Three Fingers Butte.

set.title: Little Brenna at Little Jacks Creek
set.description: She has been asking about it almost daily for weeks and finally we’re making it happen, a camp out for just Brenna and me. I liked what I saw last week motorcycling around Little Jacks Creek so that’s where we are headed with hot dogs, marshmallows and our best hiking flip-flops.

set.title: Oreana and Little Jacks Creek
set.description: Per my usual process for a solo ride, I pan around Google Earth looking to see things I haven’t seen, consult with the Idaho Trails site and finally lay out a route in the GPS software. It works great thirty percent of the time.

set.title: Three Prong Approach to Jump Creek
set.description: After running through some options to break the television-watching rain routine, we settle on the forty-five minute drive to Jump Creek Falls, what some call a “locals’” attraction because of unclear, zig-zag access through private pastures and occasional use by teen revelers.

set.title: Climbing Shoofly Oolite
set.description: Jess and I with our two youngest travel to the southern edge of prehistoric Lake Idaho for a sunny walk around one of the world’s more unique environments.

set.title: Across Swan Falls Dam
set.description: Hunter and I explore a homestead and ancient petroglyphs along the Snake River across Swan Falls Dam. Heavy clouds darken the sky as we’re close to completing our arid loop. (Before you get excited, note this route is currently closed to motor vehicles.)

set.title: Seeking Gold in Silver City
set.description: Little Brenna and I take the doors off the Jeep for a drive to Idaho’s historic Silver City and the surrounding alpine mountains. On the way we stop at the Owyhee Museum in Murphy then begins our search for the gold we finally discover in the setting sun with only a minor loss of skin.

set.title: Hunter at Hemingway Butte
set.description: Hunter and I trailer our motorcycles to the Hemingway Butte riding area where we spend the afternoon improving our hill skills. Hunter does great, especially considering it’s only his second motorcycle ride. Video (960x720): youtu.be/JOj-VBOo_aA

set.title: Long Road to Indian Hot Springs
set.description: Usually obscured by layers of rock and recollection, there are places where the history of land and people unfolds to reveal our own small place in the twining and termless chains of causality.

set.title: Jordan Craters Christmas
set.description: While my brother Jesse and Jessica’s sister Amanda are visiting for Christmas, the boys go for some adventure in snow on lava.

set.description: Our brother rides have been in North Idaho forests so it was time for different scenery. Joel and I were lucky to have good weather while visiting Succor Creek, Leslie Gulch, Birch Creek Historic Ranch and Jordan Craters.

set.title: Zeno Falls on Ben
set.description: I meet up with a new rider, Ben, for a ride south across hills arid and unknown to us around Big Jacks Creek and beyond toward Nevada. We explore a homestead and Zeno Falls before struggling to find the route home.
